function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Association between residential density and COVID-19 fatality rates","Impact":"Higher residential density is associated with a decrease in COVID-19 fatality rates, but also with an increase in obesity, which in turn is linked to higher COVID-19 fatality rates.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to address obesity in high-density residential areas to counteract the indirect effects on COVID-19 fatality rates.","Technologies":"Public health campaigns, infrastructure for physical activity, healthy food accessibility.","People":"Residents of high-density areas, public health organizations, local government.","Owner":"Local government, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Indirect correlation between regional auto centrality index and COVID-19 mortality through obesity influence","Impact":"Regional auto centrality index indirectly influences COVID-19 mortality through its effect on obesity, leading to potential increases in COVID-19 mortality.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to promote healthy transportation options and reduce reliance on automobiles, as well as address obesity in regions with high auto centrality.","Technologies":"Public transportation infrastructure, urban planning for walkability and cycling, obesity prevention programs.","People":"Residents in regions with high auto centrality, urban planners, public health organizations.","Owner":"Local government, public health organizations, urban planning authorities."},{"Description":"Indirect association between pedestrian links per square mile and COVID-19 mortality rate through street connectivity","Impact":"Greater street connectivity is indirectly associated with a decrease in COVID-19 mortality, but also with increased obesity, which could lead to higher COVID-19 mortality rates.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to promote physical activity and address obesity in areas with high street connectivity to mitigate the indirect effects on COVID-19 mortality rates.","Technologies":"Urban design for active transportation, pedestrian-friendly infrastructure, obesity prevention programs.","People":"Residents in areas with high street connectivity, urban planners, public health organizations.","Owner":"Local government, public health organizations, urban planning authorities."}]}
